data.title: So ridiculous....Bad
data.text: Can I have a Stohli...No. how bout grey goose?....no. Maybe a Corona?...no. Then and Amstel or Heineken?...no. Jesus!  Everything you'd want to order they don't have. So if you like that great. But talk about pretentious. Certainly different....if that's what you like.

data.title: Aptly named.
data.text:
We've heard a lot about this place since it opened. We tried to get in once, but it was so crowded. Tonight, we were out for a nice drink and small plates and we successfully got inside and got a table. What we learned was, this place is 'ordinary.' It's a bar, with a fancy, detailed drink list. We drink out at many spots in New Haven, and our three drinks tonight were very, very high priced for what we got. The small plates, again, were ordinary. The grilled cheese special was a non event. The meat and cheese platter (which was passionately described by our server in great detail) was completely unsatisfying. We can safely cross this off the list of places to try in New Haven. 

(Aside, the place has a nice feel, and the servers very good)

data.title: Great for cocktail snobs or newbies
data.text: Wonderful classic retro bar environment. Interesting hand crafted cocktails with locally sourced ingredients. Sit at the bar - Bartenders are nice and make it all accessible, and are fun to watch. Limited bar menu but just enough.

data.title: A Neat Little Place
data.text: This is a tiny little bar and dining room which used to be the bar at the Hotel Taft. Paneled walls and stuffed animal heads. The beer is excellent and the food is unique and interesting.

data.title: limited menu - but good food
data.text:
I tried this place on a girls night out.  found the menu extremely hard to read, small print, small menu and dimly lit interior.  Also found the food selections very limited.  we both ordered a grilled cheese with meat, I got the beef brisket and my friend got the pulled pork.  
we were underwhelmed by the portions, but the food was really good.  the crispness of the grilled cheese was amazing, and the prices were reasonable - so I guess I cant complain but we wished it came with fries or at least bigger portions.
The drink menu is extensive and expensive too.
very cool, masculine interior.  It was good, but don't think I'd be back unless I was craving a grilled cheese sandwich for dinner.

data.title: Balanced drinks served in buzzy atmosphere
data.text: Fun bar that was surprisingly busy for 10pm on a Wednesday.  They definitely take cocktails seriously but with a very approachable attitude.  There are tables in the back in addition to the long bar in the front.  Had the poutine which was good, but rather pricey.  Recommend eating at Shake Shack next door first.

data.title: Real bartenders making real drinks
data.text: Did not eat here so can't speak to quality of food. Drinks were well-prepared using many homemade ingredients and high quality spirits. This is a bar for those who care about the care going into their drinks. Highly recommended.

data.title: Will definitely be back
data.text: Outstanding service, fantastic drinks and excellent food! The BBQ brisket we ordered had a very unique taste, and the cole slaw that it came with was better than any other I've ever had - I really liked how it wasn't soaked in mayonnaise, and you could taste the vinegar in it. We both really enjoyed our visit and will definitely be back.

data.title: Excellent Bar
data.text: Bartenders absolutely knew their business. Best sazerac I've had outside New Orleans. All top shelf liquors and beers.

data.title: High end nightlife with a shot of simplicity
data.text: I went to Ordinary with a friend last night for the first time. The most noteworthy thing I can say is how extraordinarily knowledgeable the bartenders are about the spirits they have. You won't find Jack Daniels, Smirnoff, Absolut or even Jameson or Ketel here. They only have top shelf, hand picked spirits, and the staff knows everything about them and how to make the best cocktails. I didn't try the food but I saw some pretty delightful looking meals come out of the kitchen. Bottom line, if you're looking for bud light or shots of fireball, this isn't where you want to stop. This is a classy upscale experience for sure.

data.title: Worth the stop...
data.text: I had heard about this place via social media. We were going to be in New Haven to visit some friends. I suggested this place and everyone was pleased with the experience. Given the historical connection to "ordinaries" the decor was a mix of eclectic and historical. I wouldn't call this a Yale-ie bar despite it's proximity to campus. There people of all ages there and everyone mixed and mingles well. The drinks were spot on and the server was animated, informative, and friendly. The disappointment was that their barrel-aged spirits were out. Still, we ordered several food items and everything was great. Prices were reasonable. Typical $10-$15 for cocktail. Each app was between $8-$12. We stayed for nearly 2 hours and were never rushed. It's dark and mellow but not depressing. The music can be a bit loud but I noticed you could hear the music but not the lyrics. Great place!

data.title: great bar-
data.text: outstanding drink menu, great beer selection and some very nice wines as well- The food menu is a perfectly paired selection for the bar atmosphere with smoked meats, cheese boards and grilled cheese sandwich choices-  I did not try the cookie but I'll be back

data.title: Fun place to meet for drinks
data.text: Really enjoyed this place. Staff was very friendly and good at their job. Drinks were great and the food was very tasty. We had the beer cheese which we loved, pulled pork, and bacon! Great place to meet friends after work.

data.title: Boozy Heaven
data.text: This place used to be Richter's, a dive bar on Chapel Street. The owners of Ordinary have spruced it up a bit. I didn't eat here, but the drink menu was pretty fabulous. I had something with gin and lemonade and it was quite otherworldly. Someone at our table ordered the milk and cookies with sea salt, which would have made a stoner with the munchies very pleased. The food looked good, and the atmosphere was pretty lucid.

data.title: Great!
data.text:
The right place to cheer up a cold winter night in New Haven! Excellent and creative cocktails, bartenders are kind and professional. 
After 9PM the place gets really crowded, so, if you want to seat, you need to get there earlier.
Flaw: very limited selection of food and way too expensive!!

data.title: Great beer
data.text:
Came here with my husband for pre hockey game drinks and dinner.  The beer selection was good and the beer delicious.  My husband had a NEBCO Coriolis and I had Dragon’s Milk by New Holland Brewing Co.  We ordered a meat and cheese plate, BBQ mahi tacos and beer cheese.  Unfortunately we only got the cheese plate and the tacos as our waitress forgot the beer cheese and we didn’t have time to wait for it.  The tacos were sensational and the pickled slaw on it was to die for.  The meat and cheese plate was also delicious and went well with the beers.  
The service was slow and inconsistent but there was only one girl working the floor so I felt kind of badly for her. Despite the service snags, we will definitely be back here soon.

data.title: good quality
data.text: simple good food. best bbq i have had outside the south. very professional staff, busy and fair value. i would recommend this bar/restaurant.

data.title: Really cool place!
data.text: the drinks are outstanding...great location.....cool vibe .... the bartenders know their stuff...will go back!

data.title: Great environment
data.text: We used to go here way back when we were students and it was under different ownership. It is sort of fancier now but has the same woodwoodwork and moose, thankfully. We had a good time.

data.title: Great brisket & drinks
data.text: This location used to be the old "Richter's", a dive bar on the New Haven green on Chapel Street where Yalie's went to drink "yards" of beer.  The place had a certain charm in its day, but was old, dirty and tired.  I returned this week to have a drink and sandwich at the new, "Ordinary", and was thoroughly impressed.  They have completely renovated this restaurant top to bottom and restored it to what it probably looked like years ago, hand cleaning and repairing the intricate carved wooden panelling and elegant trim work with dental equipment.  The place looks gorgeous and the food was phenomenal.  I recommend the pork sandwich or the brisket which comes with their fantastic barbecue sauce and is smoked locally at their barbecue restaurant in Hamden, "Smokebox Barbecue".  No frills on the food presentation at the bar, just a great sandwich in a paper dish, but it didn't need presentation, the food was excellent.  Great service at the bar and nice atmosphere with the gothic looking chandelier lighting and old carved paneling.
